content.description: Source: Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (IDEA), 2019
content.question: Using the data from the chart, which of the following is an accurate statement about voter turnout in Nigerian elections?

choices.label: Voter turnout in parliamentary elections is consistently lower than voter turnout in presidential elections.
Voter turnout in parliamentary elections was higher than voter turnout in the presidential election in 2011.
Voter turnout for both parliamentary and presidential elections declined from 2011 to 2015.
Voter turnout in parliamentary elections has consistently decreased in the Fourth Republic.

content.answer: Voter turnout in parliamentary elections is consistently lower than voter turnout in presidential elections.

topic.text: 3.5: Nature and Role of Political Participation

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Describe patterns and trends in data.
